meanings.definition: To plant vegetation on (an area) again.
meanings.sent1: The community group revegetated the park to make it green and beautiful once more.
meanings.sent2: The barren land was revegetated with trees and flowers to restore its natural beauty.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels were surprised to see the humans revegetating their favorite spot with new plants.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness revegetated his heart, which had been barren for so long.
meanings.sent5: The act of revegetating the desert with lush greenery seemed like a miracle.

meanings.sent1: The once empty field now looked revegetated with colorful flowers and tall grass.
meanings.sent2: The revegetated hillside provided a fresh habitat for various wildlife species.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome found himself in a revegetated paradise, surrounded by greenery.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a revegetated landscape, flourishing with new ideas and creativity.
meanings.sent5: The old, abandoned lot was now a revegetated oasis in the middle of the city.
